description.en:
The course covers the following subjects: fundamentals of investing, return and risk, analysis of bonds and stocks, long-term corporate financial planning, corporate financing and cost of capital, capital budgeting, corporate failure and bankruptcy. Some topics have to be covered by students independently (as out-of-class activities).
The course will consist of series of interactive lectures that assume active students participation. There will also be computer-based practical sessions. Students will have to complete a home group project and present this in a seminar.
description.et:
Kursusel käsitletakse järgmisi teemasid: investeerimise alused, tulu ja risk, võlakirjade ja aktsiate analüüs, ettevõtte pikaajaline finantskavandamine, ettevõtte finantseerimine ja kapitali hind, kapitali eelarvestamine, äriline ebaõnnestumine ja pankrot. Mõned täiendavad teemad on tudengitele iseseisvaks läbitöötamiseks.
Kursus koosneb interaktiivsetest loengutest, mis eeldavad tudengite aktiivset osalemist. Lisaks toimuvad arvutipõhised praktikumid. Üliõpilased peavad koostama koduse grupitöö ning kandma selle ette seminaris.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to give in-depth overview of concepts and principles of corporate finance and analysis and management of investments that are largely applied in practice.
objectives.et: Ainekursuse eesmärgiks on anda süvendatud ülevaade praktikas laialdaselt kasutatavate ettevõtte rahanduse ning investeeringute analüüsi ja juhtimise kontseptsioonidest ja põhimõtetest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the successful completion of the course students have acquired knowledge about main concepts, theories and models in corporate finance and investments; students have become more familiar with an appropriate financial terminology. They also have acquired some proficiency in applying financial theories and methods in practice (e.g. how to conduct financial analysis of a company, how to estimate cost of capital, how to evaluate profitability of investment projects, how to analyze stocks and bonds, and evaluate securities' risk).
learning_outcomes.et: Aine edukal läbimisel on tudeng omandanud teadmised erialase terminoloogia ja erinevate teooriate, mudelite ja analüüsimeetodite kohta, mis leiavad kasutust ettevõtte rahandustöö korraldamisel või väärtpaberiinvesteeringute analüüsimisel. Samuti on tudeng omandanud oskuse rakendada finantsteooriaid ja meetodeid praktiliste situatsioonide käsitlemisel.

learning_outcomes.en: Students also have advanced their skills in spreadsheet-based financial modeling (using MS Excel). Team-work and organizational skills shall be also developed by the end of the course.
learning_outcomes.et: Tudengid on arendanud tabelarvutusprogrammi põhise finantsmodelleerimise oskust (MS Excel keskkonnas). Kursuse lõpuks peaksid olema edasi arendatud ka meeskonnatöö ja organisatsioonilised oskused.

notes.et: Personal feedback will be provided on request after classes or during instructor's office hours.

independent_work.et: Practical home assignments are to be completed independently. Instructions and feedback will be shared and discussed on current basis.

description.et: Home group-work (group size - 4 people), 10% of final grade

Mid-term exam in the form of multiple choice test on investments topic (closed book, 20% of final grade). Students who were absent on the day of mid-term exam may re-do the mid-term exam on the day of the final exam (i.e., during the final exam, within the same time limit).

Home assignments on topics of corporate finance and investments (5 assignments a 2%). Assignments presented after due dates will NOT be accepted! Assignments cannot be substituted with other assignments or redone.

Written final exam (60% of total grade).
One part of the exam is a fill-the-blanks test on theoretical aspects of corporate finance (closed book, 30% of final grade). The other part consists of practical cases to be solved (open book, 30% of final grade). In case of failure there is possibility to re-do the exam one time.

grade_evaluation.et: It is necessary to collect at least 51% from all the evaluation activities (mid-term exam, home assignments, final exam) in total.

debt_elimination.et: All the information is listed under assessment methods.

assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
